New Records: Orlando Arcia hit his 14th homer of the year
Sean Murphy connected for his eighth homer of the season
Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia hit two home runs, including one off reliever Max Lazar for a 5-0 lead
The Braves hit at least three home runs in a game for the 26th time this season, the most in the National League
Reynaldo LÃ³pez won his second straight start and has seemingly rebounded from an 0-3 June
Pre-Game Insights: Phillies slugger Bryce Harper said the Braves are a'really good team' and 'they're playing real good baseball right now'
Harper mentioned he's battled nagging wrist and elbow issues, but it's not anything crazy
The Phillies' No. 1 and No. 2 hitters, Kyle Schwarber and Trea Turner, were a combined 0-for-8
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson said the two home runs were just mislocations, just balls that leaked back out over the plate and they put good swings on them
Arcia said he's just a player who likes to go out there and enjoy his game, and the boos don't change much
Harper said the team has a good chance to go and beat the Braves the next two
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies paid respects to Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Gaudreau, who were killed Thursday night by a suspected drunk driver in New Jersey
The Braves send LHP Max Fried (8-7, 3.50 ERA) to the mound against Phillies RHP Zack Wheeler (12-6, 2.74 ERA)
Others: The Phillies send their deepest condolences to the Gaudreau family, and to the entire NHL family for this seismic loss to their beloved community
